Dear Claudia Cano:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on . Due
to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result in
compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the corrective
action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be completed
or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any questions. In
the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone immediately, please contact
the area manager Jessica VandenHeuvel at 616-204-6992.
Sincerely,
Shannon (Shay) Mavis

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the
following:
CCI Rule 400.4113 Employee records.
(1)An institution shall maintain employee records
for each employee and shall include
documentation of all of the following information
prior to employment or at the time specified in this
rule:
(i) Documentation from the Michigan
department of human services, the
equivalent state or Canadian provincial
agency, or equivalent agency in the country
where the person usually resides, that the
person has not been determined to be a
perpetrator of child abuse or child neglect.
The documentation shall be completed not
more than 30 days prior to the start of
employment and every 12 months thereafter.
One of twenty-nine new employee files reviewed did not have a clearance ran on
all previous last names.
Seven of twenty-nine new employee files reviewed did not have a central registry
clearance completed within 30 days prior to their hire date.
Repeat Violation Established
Original dated 3/21/24; CAP approved 3/21/24

CCI Rule 400.4120 Supervisor of direct care workers; qualifications.
(1) A supervisor of direct care workers must have 1
of the following:
(c) A high school diploma and 4 years of
work experience in a child caring institution.
The supervisor of direct care workers did not meet the requirements of the
position as she has a high school diploma, but no experience working in a child
caring institution.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
• Facility must ensure relationship is filled out on reference checks to ensure
person is not related to the candidate.
• References cannot be by people related to employee, even by marriage and
even if they're the employer.
• If a position requires a specific type of degree or certain credit requirements,
college transcripts are required to verify degree, not just diplomas.
• The facility was reminded about instructions sent on 6/17/24 regarding timely
completion and process for central registry clearances.
V. CONSULTATION
The agency was offered consultation in the following areas:
• Directions regarding how to translate documents into other languages were
provided.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 1 acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows:
The CAP for the original license was approved on 3/21/24. The CAP required the
facility to address violations for the following rules:
- 400.4113(1)(e) regarding employee references, 400.4113(1)(f)
regarding employee criminal background checks, and 400.4113(1)(i)
regarding employee central registry clearances.

o The facility created an employee file audit tool to be
completed by leadership within 7 business days.
References were sufficient for this renewal audit. The facility
also posted a position for a Human Resources Manager, but
the position has not yet been filled.
- 400.4114 regarding employee TB tests prior to hire.
o The facility fully complied with their CAP by having
employees’ complete TB testing who didn’t have it within 12
months prior to employment. In addition, based on
employee file reviews conducted for this audit, the facility
has been successful in meeting the requirements of the
licensing rule after the CAP was implemented.
Financial Overview
The facility does not yet have a financial audit completed as this is the 6-month
renewal report after licensure. According to the budget provided, there are no
financial concerns noted.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
Not Applicable
Chief Administrator Assessment
Chief Administrator assessment noted the facility’s biggest challenge has been
obtaining central registry clearances within 30 days prior to employment. Chief
Administrator reported they have now proactively assigned an additional person to
review the employee start dates in comparison to central registry checks as a
safeguard to address the issue. The facility is looking forward to youth being
admitted to the facility within the next month.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff have been working to prepare the common areas and sleeping areas for
youth. They have been organizing, cleaning, and ensuring youth needs will be met
upon admission. Staff training has continued to occur regularly as staff are
consistently being hired. The staff are restless and looking forward to youth being
admitted to the facility within the next couple of weeks.
No youth were admitted to the facility during the period of review.
Description of Agency Walk Through
A walkthrough of the facility occurred on 8/1/24 and there were no safety concerns
noted.

VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is
recommended that the agency will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
